pros: Important work in caring for the elderly

review_title: Proud to work for a faith based organization with a well-earned reputation for high quality care!

cons: Health care can be stressful; but it is the most fulfilling work for those who feel called to working with older adults!

job_title: in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: The interview process was comprehensive, we talked about the Company it's history the position I was most interested in, hours, steps to employment.  I enjoyed the recruiter she was personable, friendly and really stresses how happy she was working for such a great company, Holland Home. The recruiter I met has kept in touch with me making sure I am successful in what I do.  I feel comfortable going to her when I have questions or concerns. I enjoyed seeing how happy the residents are, the clean environment and the staff actually smiles.  The experience has been positive.
cons: Management can be slow to make changes.

review_title: Beware if you apply for an IT job
job_title: IT Engineer in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Good people in some departments
cons:
Bad business practices - Unethical 
IT staff will stab you in the back. Trust no one in the department
No Funding in IT or any part of the business at all
Old technology
No planning 
Look Elsewhere - 2 years employment "tops" for Admins and Engineers
Ask what happened to all the Admins/Engineers in the last 3 years.  They were all fired.

I did not enjoy seeing sick and elderly being mistreated.

review_title: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.
job_title: CNA in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: I absolutely loved my job. My team was amazing, and for the most part got along really well with management and nursing staff
cons: Management tends to be completely clueless when it comes to what happens on the floor in terms of resident care. Some nurses are really mean and target staff they don't like.

job_title: Dietary Aide in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Flexible work schedules. Can get overtime and company has all three shifts available. More than one facility to work at to meet new people.
cons: The management is horrible they do not value workers like they should. Too many managers feel like they can talk to staff anyway and will not help out if a department is below staffed
